Authors:
Indunil Chinthani Senanayake, Rajesh Jeewon, Erio
Camporesi, Kevin D Hyde, Sheng-Li Tian, Yu-Jia Zeng, Xie Ning
Title:
Sulcispora supratumidus sp. nov (Phaeosphaeriaceae,
Pleosporales) on Anthoxanthum odoratum from Italy
Keywords:
Combined gene analysis, Dothidiomycetes, graminicolous
fungi, one new species, spore septation
Abstract:
Sulcispora is typified by S. pleurospora which was
described from Leptosphaeria pleurospora. We collected a sulcispora-like
taxon on leaves of Anthoxanthum odoratum L. in Italy and obtained single
ascospore isolates. Combined LSU, SSU and ITS gene sequence analysis
confirmed that Sulcispora should be placed in the family
Phaeosphaeriaceae and newly collected Sulcispora species is introduced
here as S. supratumidus. Detailed descriptions and illustrations are
provided for Sulcispora supratumidus and it is compared with the type
species, Sulcispora pleurospora.
